title: Delete latest unpushed commit in Git

conversations.content: how to delete the latest commit that i've not pushed to remote

---

### Delete your latest local commit (not pushed)

Pick one option depending on whether you want to keep the changes:

- **Keep changes staged**
```bash
git reset --soft HEAD~1
```

- **Keep changes but unstaged (default)**
```bash
git reset HEAD~1
```

- **Discard the commit and its changes**
```bash
git reset --hard HEAD~1
```

Optional safety check (confirm it isnâ€™t pushed yet; replace `main` if needed):
```bash
git log --oneline origin/main..HEAD
```

If you change your mind, you can recover via:
```bash
git reflog
git reset --hard <commit_hash_before_reset>
```
